kep.parser.label_csv module¶

Read raw CSV file and emit labelled rows based on specification.

get_labelled_rows(raw_data_file, spec_file, cfg_file = None)
# Returns a list of labelled rows # raw_data_file - raw csv file with data # spec_file - header and unit definitions # config_file - segment information: start rows, end rows, spec files for each segment
kep.parser.label_csv.adjust_labels(line, cur_labels, spec_dicts)[source]¶
kep.parser.label_csv.emit_row_and_spec(raw_rows, default_dicts, segment_specs)[source]¶

Yields tuples of valid row and corresponding specification dictionaries. Works through segment_specs to determine right spec dict for each row.

kep.parser.label_csv.get_label(text, label_dict, is_label_found_func)[source]¶

Return new label for text based on lab_dict and is_label_found_func

kep.parser.label_csv.get_label_in_text(text, lab_dict)[source]¶
kep.parser.label_csv.get_label_on_start(text, lab_dict)[source]¶
kep.parser.label_csv.get_labelled_rows(raw_data_file, spec_file, cfg_file=None)[source]¶

Returns a list of labelled rows raw_data_file - raw csv file with data spec_file - header and unit definitions config_file - segment information: start rows, end rows, spec files for each segment

kep.parser.label_csv.get_labelled_rows_by_segment(raw_data_file, yaml_spec_file, yaml_cfg_file)[source]¶
kep.parser.label_csv.get_labelled_rows_no_segments(raw_data_file, yaml_spec_file)[source]¶
kep.parser.label_csv.is_year(s)[source]¶
kep.parser.label_csv.label_raw_rows_by_segment(raw_rows, default_dicts, segment_specs)[source]¶

Returns list of labelled rows, based on default specification and segment info.

kep.parser.label_csv.sf_anywhere(text, pat)[source]¶
kep.parser.label_csv.sf_start(text, pat)[source]¶

Returns (incoming_row, labels, data_row) tuple.

kep.parser.label_csv.yield_valid_rows_with_labels(incoming_rows, spec_dicts)[source]¶

Return non-empty data rows with assigned labels.

kep.parser.stream module¶

Generate stream of database-ready tuples from var-labelled rows with mixed frequencies.

Features: - defines data frequency based on number of columns in table (row) - attempts to filter data (e.g. eliminate comments in cells)

Entry point:
stream_flat_data(lab_rows)
kep.parser.stream.filter_value(text)[source]¶

Converts text to float number assuming it may contain ‘comment)’ or other unexpected contents

kep.parser.stream.get_reader_func_by_row_length(row)[source]¶
kep.parser.stream.kill_comment(text)[source]¶
kep.parser.stream.process_text_with_bracket(text)[source]¶
kep.parser.stream.split_row_by_months(row)[source]¶

Year M*12

kep.parser.stream.split_row_by_months_and_annual(row)[source]¶

Year A M*12

kep.parser.stream.split_row_by_periods(row)[source]¶

Year A Q Q Q Q M*12

kep.parser.stream.stream_flat_data(lab_rows)[source]¶

Emit varname-labeled rows as flat database-ready rows.

kep.parser.stream.yield_flat_tuples(row_tuple)[source]¶

Generate flat tuples (freq, year, qtr, month, label, val) from row components.

kep.parser.stream.yield_labelled_rows_by_component(lab_rows)[source]¶

Emit components of var-labelled rows.
